description: Proposed works: Erection of a single-storey rear side extension.
decision_conditions: <div>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</div><div><br></div><div>REASON: To mitigate against the impacts of surface water flooding.<br></div>

<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture (delete as appropriate)</p><p><br></p><p>

REASON:&nbsp; To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
